body.name: 7.0QT Large Hot Air Fryer Cooker with 8 Preset Cooking Functions, LED Touchscreen With 100 Recipes, Suitable for Family Party, Nonstick Basket, Silver
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 14 hrs 54 mins.
features: Healthy Choice:Benefit from the advanced 360°hot air circulation system, Besile air fryer makes more healthy food with up to 85% less oil.A healthy way to make all your crispy favorites. Almost no preheating enable you never run on empty calories.

Simple Operation:With the Smart digital touch-screen, just select one preset to start cooking! Along with the 8 preset options, you can set it for Baking, Frying, Grilling, Roasting, Toasting, Preheating, Dehydrating and Heat preservation.

7QT Large Capacity: Large capacity but smaller than microwave and oven. Besile hot air fryer can hold 8lbs of whole chicken. If you have 5-6 people in your family, the large capacity of this air fryer is suitable for your family and holiday gatherings.
Safe and Easy to clean:ETL certification, non-stick basket with PFOA free safely makes cleaning easier and avoids sticky foods; The Timer&Auto-Shut off function prevents overcooking.
Warranty & Customer serivice: 1 year free warranty, lifetime support and 100 E-Cookbook from Besile customer support team.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 7.0QT Large Capacity for a Family Besile air fryer with 7QT capacity, enough to supply a family of 5~6members. Versatile Cooking Methods With 360° hot air flow heating tech, you are able to bake, grill, fry or roast food with Besile air fryer. One-Touch Panel Built in digital one-touch screen menu features 8 presets to meet your demands, additional delay start, unfreeze, keep warm and preheat functions to help you operate and start cooking like a breeze.

Less oil, low fat and healthy Compared with traditional fryer, Besile air fryer makes more healthy food with up to 85% less oil. Easy to clean The Besile air fryer basket is dishwasher safe, easy to clean. The cool-touch handle prevents accidental touching of hot surfaces. Easy To Cook You only need to put the dishes in the pot, and the Besile air fryer will cook delicious and healthy recipes for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars you won't regret
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect air fryer you ever need. Throw anything you can think of to the huge basket, I usually use the preset mode and you don't need to worry about the cooking time and temperature and you got amazing food in about 15-25 min. The cleanup is easy, the tray is easy to pull out and clean. I am very pleased with this purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I bought an air fryer before, but it's hard to clean and heavy! A lot of dirt can't be removed from the rotating button. This touchscreen is very good! Very good appearance!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: We used the fryer to make spicy chicken and french fries. Tasted professional. Easy to use. Easy to clean up afterward. Not bad at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love air fryers. This one is good but not perfect.
reviews.reviewText: I'm new to air fryers. What appealed to me about getting one was the concept of less oil but also that it functions like a small oven. I like that there is a drawer/basket you pull out instead of having to reach inside a hot oven. This makes it a safer choice for a child or elderly person.While new to air fryers, this is my second one. I started with a 5Qt Besile about 1-2 months ago. I used it a lot. My picky child loves the chicken pieces I cook in it. I'm totally sold on airfyers and would have been happy enough if that was all I had. But immediately decided I wished it were bigger and so when I saw the 7Qt Besile, I got it too. Things that are different between the 2 besides size: The drawer/basket in the 5Qt is vented on one side for air circulation and basket is round. The 7Qt instead has more space in the basket and no side vents and is square. The both have a flat rack insert instead of an inner basket. The rack holds the food up for air circulation.Lets talk about side vents -- you have to be careful when emptying the bottom of the fryer of drippings, that it doesn't poor out the vents.Cleaning of both baskets is easy. Cleaning of the rack is a little more work. Didn't come out clean in the diswasher after cooking several batches of chicken. Mainly you need to know that the rack has rubber/silicone/something feet that you will have to clean around and that these feet could break and I don't know how to replace them. This is my number one concern about this unit line.I'm not particularly impressed with the concept of shaking small foods to move it around for more even browning. I suggest you manually rearrange the basket and do not make it full, unless you don't care about crispying/browning.So far I have mostly cooked chicken. A whole chicken does fit in this. It also barely fit in the 5Qt but I wasn't happy with the evenness of cooking -- too tight of a fit for good air circulation, and coming really close to the top. Chicken pieces -- I suggest you do not double layer. Understand, I want my chicken skin crispy. You can get the pieces to done if it is stacked, but you cannot get them crispy. Because of this I really think a person cooking for a family at least needs a 7Qt. 5Qt for a single person.Cookbook & manual. The manual has reasonable size print, is readable. The cookbook is an electronic copy that you can get in your email box by request. I'm not impressed with the cookbook and will probably never hunt it down on my computer again. I need a cookbook that teaches you how to cook the basics in an air fryer. I'd like the cookbook/manual to have enough of a spine to survive use and stand up on a shelf. It doesn't need to be huge, but it needs to have the right basic information and be sturdy. The unit is intuitive enough that you can do a lot without a manual.I've cooked lots of good chicken in this and am happy to have it.A++ for air fryers. B for this application of an airfryer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Great for chicken, fries and beef.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed after 6 months
reviews.reviewText: We bought this air fryer in November of 2022. By April 2023 it has stopped working. Plugged it into multiple outlets but only get a flashing screen. All outlets worked with other appliances and the breaker was not tripped. Won't be buying this one again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2022

reviews.reviewText: Ça marche bien et je suis content mais je n'ai pas reçu le livre de recettes pouvez-vous me l'envoyer merci

reviews.reviewTitle: If you don’t use parchment paper it will take forever to clean basket
reviews.reviewText: I like the size since it’s big enough to make most stuff l learnt the hard way that if you fail to use parchment paper the food will get trapped between the basket tray and even after soaking for hours and finally after only using for about a month I turned it on one day and notice that some of the led light that controls the temperature and timer was missing some numbers as the pictures show so at this point i don’t know how long it will work so buy at your own risk for the amount I paid I figured it would at least last more than a few months.
